page.title: 06 St.Marys Church - Porch
page.content: This is not officially part of the church as it is not considered to be Holy ground.In fact in Saxon days they also used to have christenings in the {Porch}because the babies were considered to be unfit to enter the church before they were christened. At the beginning of this century bread was left on the shelves in the Porch for the poor people of the village, and they still take a collection in the services to help the poor. In olden times too,the Porch was the place where legal disputes and quarrels were discussed, and even today legal notices should still be displayed on the church door inside the Porch. This door is made of thick oak and is covered with hide.
